answers.answer: I didn't have this on my first pregnancy neither,  but now omg! My feet looks like a pair of hot air balloons, nothing works, just rest, and to me seems like hot wwater makes it worse. . I had this since week 30 im 37w now and my feet are bad, but talk to your doctor  for any questions.. good luck
Drink lots of water, put your feet up, and lower your sodium intake if you can.
I would call your dr and discuss your symptoms first thing in the morning. It sounds like you could be experiencing preeclampsia. Are you having any headaches too?

I drink plenty of water and don't have much of a sodium intake. I so have headaches and I have recently been to the hospital due to having right abdominal pain. I'm going to call the doctors this morning just really hoping its not preeclampsia... I'm really scared about it being so due to me having such a rough time getting pregnant and keeping the baby.

I been experiencing that since I was 27 wks im now 35 and still happening, some nights I cant even sleep they swell up so much they itch or plain out just hurt. What helps me is lotioning them. It just cools it down and lets me sleep in peace.

question: I am 28 weeks today. For the past two weeks I've noticed more and more swelling in my feet and ankles some days it will go down a little bit but not a lot. I do work and I'm up and down all the time. While I'm home I put my feet up and tried soaking in Epsom salt, I've tried ice and heat nothing seems to help. Today I noticed that my legs are starting to tingle and hurt as well as I've noticed some spots being glossy. Should I be worried? I never had this issue with my first so I'm a little worried... please help.
title: ankles swelling and feet...
